chapter.title: Community
chapter.para: Here you can find out where to look for help, share ideas.

section.title: Mailing list
section.para: At this time there's only one list available. It's hosted on SourceForge.
To subscribe to it check following address http://sourceforge.net/mail/?group_id=87916.
You can also read archive at http://sourceforge.net/mailarchive/forum.php?forum=v-q-misc.

section.title: Forums
section.para: If you don't want to use mailing list you can always use forums available at project's SourceForge site.
There you can discuss about this software, projects around it. Users' experiences, etc.

section.title: Requests
section.para: SourceForge offers set of pages that allows you easily issue feature request, support request where you're in trouble. You can also issue a bug report.
You can also contact Pawe³ Niewiadomski directly.

section.title: Success stories
section.para: It would be great if you could share with us your story. This will help grow community around v-q. We all now that a good community around project is a great thing :-)

section.title: Reporting bugs
section.para: As all software in the world this one has also bugs. I try my best to lowerage number of them. But as with all bugs it's hard to kill them all. So if you find any please notify me.

If you find a bug please try to reproduce it. Reproducing a bug means a lot about it and helps developers to remove it ASAP. But if you're not able to reproduce it also please give us a message about it.

Project maintains public bug list which is available on SourceForge under following URL http://sourceforge.net/tracker/?group_id=87916&atid=584853. Anyone is allowed to insert entries into it. So if you find a bug go straigth to this page and write all informations that you think could help.

Informations you should include in a bug report: v-q's version, architecture, operating system, error description, messages printed by program, configuration (except passwords of course :-), action description. And of course if you can reproduce it please write all actions to do it.
If you can please write a test case for a bug and send us a patch. It will mean a lot for us.

section.title: Virtual Qmail has it's blog
section.para: Well, not exactly - its maintainer has a blog which has a separate section only for Virtual Qmail. If you want to know what going on in the project you should look there.

section.title: Authors
section.para: At this time this software is developed by a single man company called foo-baz.com which is owned by Pawe³ Niewiadomski.

section.para: Don't know what to put here. I have an online CV where you can read about my work experience. I also run a blog where you can read some articles about Virtual Qmail, Unix and other stuff that I wanted to write about.
